content.prompt: Which analysis best describes the function of the accidentals in the first chord of the example?

choices.label: The E-natural is the root and the C-sharp is the chordal seventh.
The E-natural is the chordal seventh and the C-sharp is the root.
The E-natural is diatonic to D major and the C-sharp is the leading tone.
The E-natural is a common tone and the C-sharp is the chordal fifth.

unit.text: 7: Harmony and Voice Leading IV - Secondary Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
